document_data.name: Noromath
document_data.mainbody: '''Noromath''' was a [[wikipedia:en:Duchy|duchy]] in name only, being the western half of the  [[Elf|elven]] territory of the great [[Wealdath]] forest of [[Tethyr]].
document_data.Etymology: The name "Noromath" is [[Elven language|Elvish]] for "Legacy of the North". It was called such by the [[Elmanesse]] elves of the forest.
document_data.Geography: Noromath's official borders were east of [[Greenshores|County Greenshores]], south of [[Amn]], west of [[Durmista]], and north of [[Uluran|County Uluran]]; however, the elves cared little for such [[human]] distinctions.
document_data.Population:
Noromath was the original home of the Elmanesse tribe of elves, [[Wild elf|Green elves]] from the [[Suldusk]] also occupied the region, since the tribes were unified. The major population of the western half of the forest, however, was composed of [[goblin]]s, [[hobgoblin]]s, [[centaur]]s, and [[satyr]]s.

A small population of humans lived in the town of [[Brost]] on the outskirts of the forest to the north.
document_data.Government: In [[1370 DR]], [[Allain Kevanarial|Allain "Foxfire" Kevanarial]] was the official representative of the Elmanesse tribes to the Tethyrian court. While officially a duke, he did not consider himself a duke at all, and he refused to declare any place his ducal seat.
